properties.name: Cusco - Inkatrail - MachuPicchu
properties.description: Posted by Nikkichmuracusco ,peru The ruins of Machu Picchu were rediscovered in 1911 by Yale Archeologist Hiram Bingham. This is a past city of the Inca people who believed it was a sacred place. This was a small ( a total of 5 miles) but very extrodinary city. High above the Urubamba river is where this little city sits. Filled with palaces to temples to 150 houses. The main purpose it seems is the Inca\'s astronomy center. Withsets of rocks and buildings using the the stars and sunlight to tell the date and times. The Spaniards never did find Machu Picchu even though they suspected it. They abandoned the site said to be almost forty years after the Spaniards had left Cuzco.

properties.name: Lincoln Memorial
properties.description: Posted by NikkichmuraWashington, D.C. On Memorial Day, 57 years after Lincoln died this memorial was deticated to him, our amazing 16th president. About 50000 people attended in his honor, including his only surviving son and President at the time Warren Harding. Architect Henry Bacon put very much thought into this monument, including thirty-six, greek style columns outside to symbolize the states in union at the time of his death. Also he used a mixture of stone from various staes. Daniel Chester French was the leading American sculptor in the day and created the famous lincoln statue. This, 19 feet tall, was carved out of 28blocks of white georgia marble. It is magnificent and an amazing site to see.

properties.name: Space needle
properties.description: Posted by Nikkichmura200 6th Ave N, Seattle, WA The Space Needle is a great geographical landmark located in Seattle, Washington. I have actually visited this place myself and loved it!Built in 1961, the Space Needle sits 605 ft off the ground and over looks seattle and beyond.This is why tourists flock every year to come visit it.Also a cool plus of the Space Needle is its revolvving dining room/cafe/lounge in the center of the observation deck but inside.That is very cool. With its futuristic look and remodled finish from throughout the years, it has become the symbol of Seattle, Washington.

properties.name: Sphinx
properties.description: Posted by NikkichmuraThe well known Gorgeously designed Sphinx lies near the great pyramid in Giza Valley Plateau, in Egypt. It is the single largest sculpture in the world. The sphinx is carved out of the bedrock of the surrounding plateau. The Sphinx was given its name (“Sphinx”) by the western world after the Greek creature with the head of a human and body of a lion. The Egyptians called it the Shesep-ankh at first but soon reverted to the Great Sphinx. This is a stunning monument and was created between 2558 B.C. and 2532 B.C., when pharaoh Khafre reigned. It was originally created to be his amazing funeral complex.

properties.name: Stonehenge
properties.description: Posted by NikkichmuraStonehenge, England The Stonehenge is a collection of large stones, rocks and earth that roughly forms a circle. It is located in Amesbury, Wiltshire, in Southern England. In the !940s Richard Atkinson proposed the idea that the Stonehenge was built in three stages and was most likely correct. It is believed to have been created between 2500 B.C. and 2000 B.C. This is an extremely famous historical landmark of the world. It is visited by about 750000 a year. A would be an amazing place to visit.

properties.name: Taj-Mahal
properties.description: Posted by NikkichmuraNew Delhi Regaurded as one of the eight wonders of the world, the Taj-Mahal is a gorgeously breathtaking palace. Built by the Mughal, Muslum rulers of India, the whole thing is crafted from white marble. It was built in memory of the kings dear wife Mumtaz Mahal and her grave is located in the lower chambers. Later when Shah Jahan himself died the tomb for him was added on. The Taj Mahal is said to be prettiest at dawn and sunset when all the colors reflect off the marble a nd water near. It is a gorgeous effect fit for a queen.

properties.name: Tomb of the Unknown Soldier
properties.description: Posted by NikkichmuraArlington, Virginia The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier is very highly honored and only the best, most deticated gaurds protect it daily and nightly. They must agree to very strict rules and when they are finished receive honored badges for their hard work. The tomb was designed specifically to honor those soldier not tfound or who had no name, the ones who gave their live but could not be discovered for who they were. This is a major tourist attraction too for Arlington and people flock from all over just to see it.

properties.name: grand canyon
properties.description: Posted by Nikkichmuraarizona The rocks that make up the Grand Canyon are about 1.7 billion years old but we can not tell for sure how old the actual canyo has been there. It is believed to have been made by two things, one, the Colorado River cutting throught (plus wind and ice) and eroding it. Also, two, there is the possibility of Continental Drift having a play in it too. The Grand Canyon was discovered by John Wesley Powell around the time of the civil war.He stumbled apon it while travling the Colorado river with nine other men. Before that though the Canyon was home to many Native Americans who carved their homes into its walls!

properties.name: grand ole opry
properties.description: Posted by Nikkichmuranashville, tennesse The Grand Ole Opry is actually a radio show in the tennesse area, but the actual place is where it is held. It is a huge honor to be asked to sing here at the Grand Ole Opry in Nashville and it attracts many big country stars. It was founded in 1925 and been goin strong ever since. Its official home is the Grand Ole Opry House is the place i have chosen and actually recently visited. Thats been it\'s home since 1974. If you havent visited there I would definatley reccomend it because it was a very fun time!

properties.name: mt everest
properties.description: Posted by Nikkichmuraasia The tallest mountain in the world, the highest hight above sea level, at 29,029 ft is mt. Everest. This many have attempted to climb it, and fewer succeeded. It was formed about 60 million years ago and is located between Nepal and Tibet. The name the Nepal people call it is Sagarmatha, which means Goddess of the sky. In Tibet it is referred to as Chomolunga, meaning mother goddess of universe. The frist assent was on May 29, 1953 made by Sir Edmond Hillary. The frist American was James Whittiker, who accomplished this in 1963, ten years later.
